Jorge Martin Tolak Tawaran KTM ke MotoGP, Abaikan Ducati
01 Nov 2019, 15:20 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Debutan Moto2, Jorge Martin, menolak tawaran KTM naik ke MotoGP musim depan. Hal ini diakui Martin kepada Marca di Sepang, Malaysia, Kamis (31/11/2019), sepekan setelah Brad Binder dan Iker Lecuona masing-masing diumumkan membela Red Bull KTM Factory Racing dan Red Bull KTM Tech 3 pada 2020.
Perombakan besar di tubuh KTM terjadi akibat Johann Zarco memutuskan hengkang setahun lebih awal. Binder yang tadinya telah diumumkan bakal membela Tech 3, justru dialihkan ke tim pabrikan. Atas alasan ini, KTM juga harus putar otak untuk mencari pebalap kedua untuk Tech 3.
Dalam pekan balap di Jepang, rider SAG Team Moto2, Remy Gardner, mengaku mendapat tawaran dari KTM untuk naik ke MotoGP, namun menolaknya. Tawaran KTM pun akhirnya jatuh ke tangan Lecuona, yang tadinya sempat diumumkan bakal membela Red Bull KTM Ajo di Moto2, bertandem dengan Martin.
Uniknya, kini Martin mengaku juga mendapat tawaran untuk naik ke MotoGP, namun segera menolaknya. Juara dunia Moto3 2018 ini mengaku hanya diwakili sang manajer, Albert Valera, untuk melakukan diskusi, namun tetap ingin bertahan di Moto2 untuk meraih gelar dunia 2020.

Jorge Martin Rejects KTM Bid to MotoGP, Ignore Ducati
Nov 01 2019, 15:20 by Bola.net
Soccer.net - Moto2's debut, Jorge Martin, refused KTM's offer to rise to MotoGP next season. Martin acknowledged this to Marca in Sepang, Malaysia, Thursday (11/31/2019), a week after Brad Binder and Iker Lecuona were each announced to defend Red Bull KTM Factory Racing and Red Bull KTM Tech 3 in 2020.
A major reshuffle in the body of the KTM occurred because Johann Zarco decided to leave a year earlier. Binder which had been announced would defend Tech 3, instead it was transferred to the manufacturer's team. For this reason, KTM must also turn the brain to look for the second rider for Tech 3.
In a racing week in Japan, SAG Team Moto2 rider Remy Gardner claimed to have been offered by KTM to rise to MotoGP, but refused. The bid of KTM finally fell into the hands of Lecuona, who had previously been announced would defend the Red Bull KTM Ajo in Moto2, bertandem with Martin.
Interestingly, now Martin claimed to also get an offer to rise to MotoGP, but immediately refused. The 2018 Moto3 world champion claimed to only be represented by his manager, Albert Valera, to hold discussions, but he still wanted to stay on Moto2 to win the 2020 world title.
